heading: Quickstart
text:
🚀 Run ShiNyP via
R🚀 Run ShiNyP via
Docker📢 ShiNyP Online Version – Trial
Platform

heading: Overview
text:
ShiNyP platform designed real-time processing, analysis, 
visualization SNP datasets.📄 Input: Genome-wide biallelic SNP Variant Call Format (VCF) file.
📊 Analysis: Data QC, population genetics analysis, core collection, .
📋 Output: Publication-ready figures, tables, R objects, free AI-driven report.

heading: Publication
text:
use ShiNyP research, please cite:Huang, Y.-H., Chen, L.-Y., Septiningsih E. M., Kao, P.-H., Kao, C.-F.
(2025) ShiNyP: Unlocking SNP-Based Population Genetics—
AI-Assisted Platform Rapid Interactive Visual Exploration.
Molecular Biology Evolution, 43(6), msaf117.
https://doi.org/10.1093/molbev/msaf117In addition, please acknowledge R packages utilized 
analysis. relevant citations descriptions module 
detailed  ShiNyP User
Guide.

heading: ✅ Prerequisites
text:
installing ShiNyP, ensure system meets following
requirements:R: Version ≥ 4.4.
Check current version R: getRversion()R: Version ≥ 4.4.Check current version R: getRversion()Bioconductor: Version ≥
3.20.
Match Bioconductor version R version (e.g., use
Bioconductor 3.21 R = 4.5).Bioconductor: Version ≥
3.20.Match Bioconductor version R version (e.g., use
Bioconductor 3.21 R = 4.5).

heading: 1️⃣ Install Required Package
code:
install.packages("BiocManager")
BiocManager::install(version = "3.21") # Use the version that matches your R
BiocManager::install(c("qvalue", "SNPRelate", "ggtree", "snpStats"), force = TRUE)

heading: 4️⃣ Run Analysis on ShiNyP
text:
Input SNP dataset VCF, try built-Demo
Data.

heading: 🔘 Run ShiNyP via Docker
text:
🐳 Docker installed, can launch ShiNyP without
installing R.

heading: ✅ Prerequisite
text:
Docker.
Verify Docker installation Terminal: docker --versionDocker.Verify Docker installation Terminal: docker --version

heading: 2️⃣ Start the ShiNyP Platform
text:
Open browser visit 👉
http://localhost:3838

heading: Main Features
text:
🔼 Overview ShiNyP Platform Workflow SNP Analysis.
▸ Data Input & Processing:
workflow begins Variant Call Format (VCF) Data Input, followed essential steps Data Quality Control (QC) Data Transformation prepare data analysis.
▸ Modular Analysis & Output:
Analytical functions organized distinct modules—accessible separate page within platform. include: Population Structure, Genetic Diversity, Selection Sweep, Core Collection. module contains multiple subpages offering specialized tools detailed analysis.
▸ Customizable Output:ShiNyP delivers publication-ready visualizations AI Report summarize analytical results clear, structured narratives. Users can tailor output formats fit specific research needs.

heading: 1 Data Input
text: ➡️ section includes two subpages: VCF data.frame/genlight, allowing upload work different data formats analysis.

heading: Required File:
text:
ShiNyP accepts VCF files following formats:VCF file PLINKVCF gzipped VCF (vcf.gz) file 
VCFtoolsVCF file RDS format previously saved ShiNyPNote: VCF file contain chromosome position
information first two columns
(#CHROM 
POS), along sample names 
genotypic information. whole genome sequencing (WGS)
data, SNP marker ID information missing, ShiNyP 
auto-generate SNP ID names #CHROM:POS, 
2:12500, indicating chromosome 2, position 12500.

heading: Step 1: Upload VCF File
text:
Click Browse select upload VCF file.file generated using VCFtools, make sure check 
“VCF file VCFtools” option.progress bar shows ‘Upload complete’, click Input VCF
File proceed.Use Demo DataClick Use Demo
Data choose 
species list.details demo datasets, visit:
https://github.com/TeddYenn/ShiNyP/tree/main/inst/demo_data.Note: default, interactive table display genotype data
5 samples 10 SNPs preview.

heading: Step 2: Transform to data.frame
text:
uploading VCF file, click Transform 
data.frame.Download generated data.frame Site Info (RDS
format) skip VCF upload next time directly importing 
files.Note: ShiNyP optimized genome-wide SNP analysis 
diploid species. haploid polyploid data, please check
“Applying diploidization processing” option.

heading: Outputs:
text:
VCF Data (RDS): Raw VCF data RDS format, readable R.data.frame (RDS): Contains genotypic data — required 
downstream analysis.Site Info. (RDS): Contains SNP site information — required 
downstream analysis.Note: large datasets (>1GB), processing may take time.
ShiNyP handles one task time — please wait step 
complete proceeding.

heading: Required File:
text: data.frame RDS formatgenlight RDS formatNote: data.frame available subpages VCF, Sample QC, SNP QC, Core Sample Set, Core SNP Set.genlight available Data Transform page.

heading: Step 1: Upload File
text:
Browse select file, click
Input upload.

heading: 2 Data QC
text: ➡️ section includes three subpages: Sample QC, SNP QC, SNP Density, allowing assess quality samples SNPs data.frame, well visualize SNP density across genome.

heading: Required File:
text:
data.frame file Data Input page orSNP post-QC data.frame file Data QC/SNP
QC subpage .

heading: Step 1: Get Summary
text:
First, obtain sample summary statistics (missing rate 
heterozygosity rate) clicking 
Summary buttons 
see results.

heading: Step 2: Sample QC
text:
Adjust thresholds click Sample QC 
Thresholds. 
generate Post-QC data.frame file.Note: prefer perform sample QC sample missing
rate heterozygosity rate, please set threshold 0.

heading: Outputs:
text:
data.frame (RDS): Updated data.frame file — required 
downstream analysis.Site Info. (RDS): Updated SNP site information file — required 
downstream analysis.

heading: Required File:
text:
data.frame file Data Input page orSample post-QC data.frame file Data
QC/Sample QC subpage.

heading: Step 1: Get Summary
text:
First, obtain SNP summary statistics [missing rate, minor allele
frequency (MAF), heterozygosity rate, Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium
(HWE)] clicking 
Summary buttons 
see results.

heading: Step 2: Sample QC
text:
Adjust thresholds click SNP QC 
Thresholds. 
generate Post-QC data.frame file.Note: prefer perform QC based SNP missing rate 
heterozygosity rate, set missing rate threshold 1, MAF 
0, heterozygosity rate 0 1. Also, leave ‘SNP QC
HWE’ checkbox unticked skip QC based SNP HWE.

heading: Outputs:
text:
data.frame (RDS): Updated data.frame file — required 
downstream analysis.Site Info. (RDS): Updated SNP site information file — required 
downstream analysis.

heading: Required Files:
text:
Site Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable 
Data Input Data QC pages.Site Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable 
Data Input Data QC pages.Chromosome Info. (CSV): Reference genome information current
study.
Click
:
Download example Chromosome Info. (CSV).Chromosome Info. (CSV): Reference genome information current
study.Click
:
Download example Chromosome Info. (CSV).Data source:
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/datasets/genome/GCF_034140825.1/

heading: Steps:
text: Upload Site Info. (RDS) Chromosome Info. (CSV).Choose window size kilobases (kb).Click Summary.

heading: Outputs:
text:
SNP Density Plot (PDF): ideogram visualizing SNP density across
genome within defined window size. gradient color palette 
used represent varying SNP densities: green lower
densities, yellow medium densities,
red higher densities, grey indicating
regions zero SNP.SNP Density (CSV): table detailing SNP density across 
chromosome. bp_over_SNPs: total base pairs (bp) per SNP 
window, representing average spacing SNPs.
SNPs_over_1000bp: number SNPs per 1,000 base pairs,
providing normalized measure SNP density across genome.

heading: 3 Data Transform
text:
➡️ section allow convert SNP data data.frame 
multiple formats, including genind, genind PLINK.

heading: Required File:
text:
Input VCF Data (data.frame file) Data Input
page orPost-QC Data (data.frame file) Data QC
page.

heading: Step 1: Transform data.frame to genlight
text:
Click Transform 
genlight.Download generated genlight (RDS format) skip VCF 
data.frame upload next time directly importing file.

heading: Output:
text:
genlight (RDS): genlight file — required downstream
analysis.

heading: Step 2: Transform genlight to others
text:
Select desired data format export genlight click
Transform.

heading: Outputs:
text:
genlight (RDS): genlight file Group Info. — required 
downstream analysis.genind (RDS): One input format ShiNyP
DAPC subpage, optimized DAPC analysis reduce
computation time.following transformed files generated specified path
provide.PLINK (PED & MAP): Input format 
PLINK program,
designed perform range basic large-scale SNP analyses.GenAlEx (CSV): Input format 
GenAlEx
program, offers wide range population genetic analysis 
Excel.LEA (GENO & LFMM): Input format 
LEA
R package, designed population genomics, landscape genomics 
genotype-environment association tests.GDS (GDS): Input format 
SNPRelate
R package, designed efficient SNP data analysis.STRUCTURE (STR): Input format 
STRUCTURE
program, used inferring population structure.fastStructure (STR): Input format 
fastStructure program,
used inferring population structure large SNP data.PHYLIP (TXT): Input format 
PHYLIP program, used 
phylogenetic tree reconstruction evolutionary analysis.Treemix (GZ): Input format 
Treemix program,
designed modeling population splits migration events.BayeScan (TXT): Input format 
BayeScan,
used detecting loci selection.

heading: 4 Population Structure
text:
➡️ section includes seven subpages: PCA,
DAPC, UPGMA Tree, NJ Tree,
Kinship, Scatter PlotPlus, Tree
PlotPlus, allowing conduct various population
structure analyses customize plot.

heading: 4.1 PCA (Principal Component Analysis)
text:
widely used method uncover underlying population structure 
reducing dimensionality genetic data.

heading: Required File:
text: data.frame

heading: One Step:
text:
Click Run PCA 
generate PCA plots following downloadable files.Note: can upload Group Info. (Population
Structure/DAPC) Core Sample Info. (
Core Collection/Core Sample Set) 
classify individuals color PCA Scatter Plot.

heading: Outputs:
text:
PCA Scatter Plot (PDF): scatter plot showing distribution 
samples based principal components, dot representing 
individual.PC Explained Variance Plot (PDF): Visualizes variance explained
principal component.Explained Variance (CSV): Contains explained variance 
principal component.PCA Transformed Data (CSV): Dataset transformed principal
components, samples rows principal components 
columns.PCA Object (RDS): Contains PCA results future use 
reproducibility, can used input data Population
Structure/Scatter PlotPlus subpage.

heading: 4.2 DAPC (Discriminant Analysis of Principal Components)
text:
multivariate method identifying visualizing genetic clusters
combining PCA Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) (Jombart, Devillard, Balloux 2010).
information, visit
https://adegenet.r-forge.r-project.org/files/tutorial-dapc.pdf.

heading: Required File:
text: genlight orgenind (faster)

heading: Step 1: Cluster Identification
text:
Click Run DAPC 
determine optimal number clusters (lowest BIC value
indicates optimal number clusters).Note: default number PC axes cluster identification 
set retain PCs capture 80% total variance. 
can refer “PC Explained Variance Plot” Population
Structure/PCA subpage.

heading: Step 2: DAPC Analysis
text:
Choose number cluster (K) based “Bayesian Information
Criterion (BIC) Plot”.Click Run DAPC II
generate DAPC plots following downloadable files.Note: can download “DAPC Object” upload 
Population Structure/Scatter PlotPlus
subpage customize 2D 3D scatter plots.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) Plot (PDF): Visual
representation BIC model selection.Density Plot First & Second Discriminant Function (PDF): Displays
density first second discriminant functions, 
row bar representing individual.DAPC Scatter Plot (PDF): scatter plot showing distribution 
samples based discriminant functions (x-axis: first discriminant
function; y-axis: second discriminant function), dot
representing individual.DAPC Membership Probability Plot (PDF): Visualizes membership
probabilities individuals different groups, row bar
representing individual.DAPC Group Info. (CSV): Contains group assignments 
individual based DAPC. file used various subpages.DAPC Transformed Data (CSV): Dataset transformed discriminant
functions samples rows discriminant functions 
columns.DAPC Object (RDS): Contains results DAPC analysis 
future reproducibility. can used input data 
Population Structure/Scatter PlotPlus
Core Collection/Core SNP Set
subpages.

heading: 4.3 UPGMA (Unweighted Pair Group Method with Arithmetic mean) Tree
text:
classic approaach constructing rooted trees based genetic
distance data. UPGMA tree generated poppr ggtree packages
(Yu et al. 2016; Kamvar, Tabima, Grünwald 2014).

heading: Required File:
text: genlight

heading: Steps:
text:
Choose number bootstrap replicates, used 
assessing confidence branching structure.Click Run UPGMA 
generate tree plot.Note: can download “UPGMA Object” upload 
Population Structure/Tree PlotPlus
subpage customize phylogenetic tree.

heading: Outputs:
text:
UPGMA Phylogenetic Tree (PDF): UPGMA rooted tree 
user-defined layout style.UPGMA Object (RDS): Contains information UPGMA tree, 
can used input data Population
Structure/Tree PlotPlus subpage.

heading: 4.4 NJ (Neighbor-Joining) Tree
text:
method building unrooted trees using genetic distance data. NJ
tree generated ape ggtree packages (Paradis Schliep 2018; Yu et al. 2016).

heading: Required File:
text: genlight

heading: One Step:
text:
Click Run NJ 
generate tree plot.Note: can download “NJ Object” upload 
Population Structure/Tree PlotPlus
subpage customize phylogenetic tree.

heading: Outputs:
text:
NJ Phylogenetic Tree (PDF): NJ unrooted tree user-defined
layout style.NJ Object (RDS): Contains information NJ tree, can 
used input data Population Structure/Tree
PlotPlus subpage.

heading: 4.5 Kinship Analysis
text:
statistical method assessing genetic relationships relatedness
among individuals based shared alleles (Kang et al. 2010). Kinship matrix 
generated statgenGWAS package.information, visit
https://rdrr.io/cran/statgenGWAS/man/kinship.html.

heading: Required File:
text: data.frame

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Group Info. Population
Structure/DAPC subpage (optional). 
uploaded, order samples follow group assignment;
otherwise, follow order original VCF data.Choose method run kinship analysis.Click Run
Kinship button 
generate kinship matrix.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Kinship Matrix Plot (PDF): visual representation kinship
matrix.Kinship Matrix (RDS): Contains kinship matrix data.Note: kinship matrix can directly used input 
GAPIT package genome-wide association studies (GWAS), helping 
control confounding effects.

heading: 4.6 Scatter Plot Plus
text:
Customize scatter plot based results Population
Structure/PCA Population
Structure/DAPC.

heading: Required Files:
text:
PCA Object (PCA_prcomp_Object.rds file) DAPC Object
(DAPC_dapc_Object.rds file)Group Info. (.e. metadata, modifiable 
DAPC_Group_Info.csv)Note: using DAPC object input, ensure 
least 4 groups. Since N groups N-1 LD axes, need 
3 axes generate 3D scatter plot.Note: can add metadata (information samples) 
adding new variables Group Info. file. Ensure sample
order remains unchanged.

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload PCA DAPC Object (RDS).Upload Group Info. (CSV).Click Run Scatter
Plot generate
2D 3D interactive scatter plots.Customize scatter plot click Run Scatter
Plot .Note: scatter plots downloaded HTML files can 
opened browsers like Chrome Edge.

heading: Outputs:
text:
2D Scatter Plot (HTML): Two-dimensional interactive scatter plot
user-defined attributes.3D Scatter Plot (HTML): Three-dimensional interactive scatter plot
user-defined attributes.

heading: 4.7 Tree Plot Plus
text:
Customize phylogenetic tree plot based results 
Population Structure/UPGMA Population
Structure/NJ.

heading: Required Files:
text:
UPGMA Object (UPGMA_phylo_Object.rds file) NJ Object
(NJ_phylo_Object.rds file)Group Info. (modifiable DAPC_Group_Info.csv)Note: can add information samples adding new
variables Group Info. file. Ensure sample order
remains unchanged.

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload UPGMA NJ Object (RDS).Upload Group Info. (CSV).Click Run Tree
Plot generate
tree plot.Customize tree plot click Run Tree
Plot .

heading: Outputs:
text:
Phylogenetic Tree Plot (PDF): phylogenetic tree plot 
user-defined layout style attributes.

heading: 5 Genetic Diversity
text:
➡️ section includes four subpages: Diversity
Parameter, Circos Plot, Genetic
Distance, AMOVA, allowing conduct
various population diversity differentiation analyses.

heading: 5.1 Diversity Parameter
text:
Calculate key diversity parameters SNP site. approach 
performed using function snpReady package (Granato et al. 2018).

heading: Required File:
text:
data.frameSite Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable 
Data Input Data QC pages.Note: upload Group Info., ensure group contains
least 2 samples.

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Site Info. (required).Upload Group Info. Population
Structure/DAPC subpage (optional). 
uploaded, population-based parameters calculated.Click Run Diversity
Analysis 
generate genetic diversity following downloadable files.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Plot Genetic Diversity Statistics per Site (PDF): genome-wide
scatter plot visualizing user-selected parameter.Plot Genetic Diversity Statistics Group (PDF): lollipop plot
visualizing user-selected parameter.Genetic Diversity per Site (RDS): Contains site information 
diversity statistics, can used input data Selection
Sweep/Manhattan PlotPlus.Genetic Diversity Object (RDS): Contains genetic diversity
results future use reproducibility.Genetic Diversity Group (CSV): table showing genetic diversity
based defined group assignments.Fst Matrix (CSV): table showing pairwise Fst based defined
group assignments.

heading: 5.2 Circos Plot
text:
Genome-wide diversity visualized using Circos plots generated 
circlize package (Gu et al. 2014) based results diversity
parameters sliding window format.

heading: Required File:
text:
Auto-import results Genetic
Diversity/Diversity Parameter subpage.Chromosome Info. (CSV): Reference genome information current
study. details file, refer Section
2.3 (SNP Density).Note: Please ensure chromosome contains least one SNP
marker.

heading: Step 1: Sliding Window
text:
Select parameters generate sliding window data.Choose window size (kb) step size (kp).Click Run Sliding
Window generate
sliding window data Circos plot.

heading: Step 2: Circos Plot
text:
Upload Chromosome Info. (CSV).Select parameter track, add tracks necessary (
maximum 6).Click Run Circos
Plot generate
Circos plot.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Sliding Window Data (CSV): sliding window dataset based 
user-selected parameters.Circos Plot (PDF): circos plot visualizing user-selected
parameters, top 1% parameter colored red.

heading: 5.3 Genetic Distance
text:
Pairwise genetic distance populations computed using
hierfstat package. information, visit
https://rdrr.io/cran/hierfstat/man/genet.dist.html.

heading: Required File:
text:
data.frameGroup Info. Population
Structure/DAPC subpage (required).

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Group Info.Select method.Click Run Genetic
Distance 
generate pairwise genetic distance.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Genetic Distance Plot (PDF): plot pairwise genetic distance
matrix based user-selected method.Genetic Distance Matrix (CSV): pairwise genetic distance matrix
based user-selected method.

heading: 5.4 AMOVA (Analysis of MOlecular VAriance)
text:
method assessing genetic variations relationships within 
populations (Excoffier, Smouse, Quattro 1992). approach performed using
function hierfstat poppr packages (Kamvar, Tabima, Grünwald 2014; GOUDET 2004).

heading: Required File:
text:
genlight ‘Group Info.’, downloadable Data
Transform page Group Info.

heading: Step 1: Run AMOVA
text:
Click Run AMOVA 
partition genetic variation among within populations.

heading: Step 2: Run Permutation Test
text:
Choose number randomizations permutation test 
detect significance three hierarchical levels. recommend
using 9, 99 (default), 199, 499, 799, 999 permutations 
classical p-values.Click Run Permutation
Test perform 
statistical test.

heading: Outputs:
text:
AMOVA Variance Plot (PDF): pie chart showing explained genetic
variance population strata among defined groups.AMOVA Variance Test (PDF): plot showing significance test 
population strata among defined groups. histograms depict
randomized strata distributions, black line representing
genetic variance components.AMOVA Table (CSV): table detailed AMOVA results.

heading: 6 Selection Sweep
text:
➡️ section includes four subpages: pcadapt,
OutFLANK, IBS, Manhattan
PlotPlus, allowing detect selection signatures 
different scenario customize plot.

heading: 6.1 pcadapt
text:
PCA-based approach identifies selective outliers relative 
population structure (Luu, Bazin, Blum 2016).

heading: Required Files:
text:
data.frameSite Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable 
Data Input Data QC pages.

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Site Info. (required).Click SNP Thinning
(optional) choose window size (number SNPs) r² threshold.
information, visit
https://bcm-uga.github.io/pcadapt/articles/pcadapt.html.Click Run pcadapt
perform genome scan selection.

heading: Outputs:
text:
pcadapt p-value per site (RDS): dataset containing p-values 
adjusted p-values site.pcadapt Manhattan Plot (PDF): Manhattan plot visualizing 
p-values per site across genome. Significant SNPs 
highlighted red.pcadapt QQ Plot (PDF): QQ plot comparing distribution 
observed p-values expected distribution null
hypothesis.pcadapt Histogram p-values (PDF): histogram showing 
distribution p-values across sites.pcadapt Histogram Test Statistics (PDF): histogram showing 
distribution test statistics across sites.pcadapt Significant SNPs (CSV): table listing SNPs identified 
significant pcadapt, including site info., p-values, 
adjusted p-values.

heading: 6.2 OutFLANK
text:
Fst-based approach detects selection signals comparing genetic
differentiation defined group assignments (Whitlock Lotterhos 2015). 
information, visit https://rpubs.com/lotterhos/outflank.

heading: Required Files:
text:
genlight ‘Group Info.’, downloadable Data
Transform page Group Info.Site Info. (RDS) current genlight downloadable Data
Input Data QC pages.

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Site Info. (required).Click Run OutFLANK
perform genome scan selection.

heading: Outputs:
text:
OutFLANK p-value per site (RDS): dataset containing p-values 
adjusted p-values site.OutFLANK Manhattan Plot (PDF): Manhattan plot visualizing 
p-values per site across genome. Significant SNPs 
highlighted red.OutFLANK QQ Plot (PDF): QQ plot comparing distribution 
observed p-values expected distribution null
hypothesis.OutFLANK Histogram p-values (PDF): histogram showing 
distribution p-values across sites.OutFLANK Histogram Fst (PDF): histogram showing 
distribution Fst values across sites.OutFLANK Significant SNPs (CSV): table listing SNPs identified 
significant OutFLANK, including site info., Fst values, 
p-values.

heading: 6.3 IBS (Identity By State)
text:
approach detect differences genomic regions pairs 
individuals, useful identifying pedigree relationships.

heading: Required Files:
text:
data.frameSite Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable 
Data Input Data QC pages.Chromosome Info. (CSV): Reference genome information current
study. details file, refer Section
2.3 (SNP Density).

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Site Info. (required).Upload Chromosome Info. (CSV) (required).Choose reference comparison samples.Select window size (kb) step size (kp).remove heterozygous SNPs reference sample, click Remove
heterozygous SNPs
checkbox (optional).Click Run IBS 
perform IBS analysis.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Chromosome Ideogram (PDF): ideogram visualizing IBS results,
using gradient palette represent differences across
chromosomes.Sliding Window Data (CSV): sliding window dataset IBS
results, including SNP count, different SNPs, ratio 
different SNPs per window.

heading: 6.4 Manhattan Plot Plus
text:
Customize phylogenetic tree plot based results Genetic
Diversity/Diversity Parameter, Selection
Sweep/pcadapt, Selection
Sweep/OutFLANK.

heading: Required Files:
text:
Genetic Diversity per Site (Genetic_Diversity_per_Site.rds), pcadapt
p-value per Site (pcadapt_p-value_per_site.rds), OutFLANK p-value
per Site (OutFLANK_p-value_per_site.rds).Chromosome Info. (CSV): Reference genome information current
study. details file, refer Section
2.3 (SNP Density).

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload genetic_diversity/pcadapt_pvalue/OutFLANK_pvalue per site
object (RDS).Upload Chromosome Info. (CSV).Click Run Manhattan
Plot generate
Manhattan plot.Customize Manhattan plot click Run Manhattan
Plot .

heading: Outputs:
text:
Manhattan Plot (PDF): Manhattan plot user-defined layout
style attributes.Note: generating plot p-values, make sure use ‘-log10’
transformation Y axis.

heading: 7 Core Collection
text:
➡️ section includes two subpages: Core Sample Set,
Core SNP Set, allowing capture key samples
SNPs.

heading: 7.1 Core Sample Set
text:
Establish core collection represents genetic variation 
entire population. approach modified function GenoCore
(Jeong et al. 2017).

heading: Required File:
text: data.frame

heading: Steps:
text:
Choose minimum genetic coverage (%).Choose minimum genetic coverage differences iterations.Click Run Core
Sample perform
core collection.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Core Sample Coverage Data (CSV): table listing coverage (%) 
iteration coverage differences iterations.Core Sample Set (RDS): data.frame core samples 
genotypic information.Core Sample Info. (CSV): table listing whether sample 
included core collection , can used input
data Population Structure/PCA
subpage.Coverage Plot Core Sample Set (PDF): Visualizes sample
coverage iteration.

heading: 7.2 Core SNP Set
text:
Establish core SNP collection represents genetic variation
observed full dataset random SNP set.

heading: Required Files:
text:
data.frameSite Info. (RDS) current data.frame, downloadable

heading: ✨ Tasks for AI
text:
Summary Request: Provide clear, structured overview key SNP
analysis results.Data Interpretation: Clarify findings highlight key insights
population genetics.Report Structuring: Create framework presenting SNP
analysis results scientific report.Idea Expansion: Propose future research directions informed 
SNP findings.

heading: 🔑 How to get the API key
text:
1️⃣ Sign Log :Google: https://aistudio.google.com/OpenAI: https://auth.openai.com/create-accountDeepSeek: https://platform.deepseek.com/sign_in2️⃣ Generate API Key:Google: Click “Create API Key” bottom
https://aistudio.google.com/apikeyOpenAI: https://platform.openai.com/api-keysDeepSeek: https://platform.deepseek.com/api_keys3️⃣ Save API Key:Copy generated key paste Notepad file.Save file .txt ShiNyP use.4️⃣ Manage Billing & Payments:OpenAI:
https://platform.openai.com/settings/organization/billing/overviewDeepSeek: https://platform.deepseek.com/top_upNote: Costs vary depending model, conversation mode, 
AI task requested.

heading: ❌ Encountered an error? Let’s fix it!
text:
⚠️ Error: HTTP 401 Unauthorized
error message indicates authentication credentials
invalid. happen several reasons, :
using revoked API key.
using different API key one requesting
organization.
using API key required
permissions endpoint calling.
resolve error, first check using correct
API key organization ID request header.

trial purposes. Please note , due server memory limitations
(1GB RAM), version suitable analysis 
large-scale SNP datasets. complete functionality analyze
larger datasets, strongly recommend downloading ShiNyP 
GitHub.

heading: Analysis & Features
text:
makes ShiNyP different SNP analysis tools?
ShiNyP uniquely integrates modular Graphical User Interface
(GUI), ShiNyP AI (real-time chatbot), cross-species compatibility,
AI-based interpretation, customizable visualizations, 
open-source accessibility—one platform, making versatile
tool researchers genomics, breeding, evolutionary
biology.makes ShiNyP different SNP analysis tools?ShiNyP uniquely integrates modular Graphical User Interface
(GUI), ShiNyP AI (real-time chatbot), cross-species compatibility,
AI-based interpretation, customizable visualizations, 
open-source accessibility—one platform, making versatile
tool researchers genomics, breeding, evolutionary
biology.types input data supported ShiNyP?
ShiNyP supports genome-wide biallelic SNP datasets Variant Call
Format (VCF). also compatible data.frame genlight
files, covering diploid polyploid species.
information: Data

Format (VCF). also compatible data.frame genlight
files, covering diploid polyploid species.information: Data

platform generates publication-ready figures (PDF, PNG, JPEG)
tables, reusable R data objects, AI-assisted reports 
summarize analytical results natural language.kind output platform provide?platform generates publication-ready figures (PDF, PNG, JPEG)

heading: Installation Issues
text:
encounter issues installing ShiNyP, please don’t
hesitate let us know. issue may unique , 
reporting , help improve entire community. 
common installation issues:R Bioconductor version mismatch
installation specifies Bioconductor version 3.21, requires
R version ≥ 4.5. R version 4.5, update 
CRAN.

# Check R version 
R.version.stringR Bioconductor version mismatchThe installation specifies Bioconductor version 3.21, requires

sessions using package, restart try installing
